formattedAddress: 253 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 253 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text:
This spot may have one of the most romantic vibes in NYC and not only that but they are also serving up authentic Moroccan dishes that will have me back for more! Especially those lamb chops!

Here were our meal highlights:

üçä Orange Salad w/ honey pomegranate molasses
üçñ French Lamb Chops w/ a mint sauce and mushrooms
üçó Chicken with Pomegranate Molasses, Honey, Harissa, Kalamata Olives & Almonds
üç∞ Mango Cheesecake

originalText.text: The tagine at @tarakitchenusa were spicy and satisfying. Their menu is pretty authentic but still caters well towards American palates with heavier seasoning. The lamb was not that tender so took a while to chew - would probably just go for the veggie dishes instead in the future.

text.text: The tagine at @tarakitchenusa were spicy and satisfying. Their menu is pretty authentic but still caters well towards American palates with heavier seasoning. The lamb was not that tender so took a while to chew - would probably just go for the veggie dishes instead in the future.

originalText.text:
Really surpassed my expectations. Satin was amazing. Enjoyed the delicious food, atmosphere, music.
Satin recommended the facade bean salad and it was delicious had the lamb meatballs so good. Lamb and chicken tahini, so flavorful. Substantial amount of food, pita, continuously replenished without asking.
Wine was great. Dessert- mango cheesecake and baklava, very tasty.
Satin was awesome, she made the whole experience. Will be back. Totally recommend.

originalText.text:
Step into tara kitchen for a culinary fusion like no other. With a mix of Indian and Moroccan flair, this place is a flavor paradise. Big shoutout to Omar for the stellar service and the gorgeous decor that adds to the vibe make it so romantic. We started with the orange salad, a sweet and refreshing kick-off to a fantastic meal.

The Casablanca spread with warm pita is very delicious, and the grilled Red Snapper with lentil and citrus salad is flavorful.
For seafood lovers, the seafood Tagines is a must-try. Vegans have plenty of options. We tried the Couscous. It has seven vegi and so delicious. And don‚Äôt forget the dessert-the homemade Baklava is pure indulgence.

Tara kitchen is a culinary gem with unforgettable blend of flavors and a fantastic dining experience.

originalText.text:
Tara Kitchen in the Tribeca has possible one of the best service in town. Staffs with big smiles grinning ear to ear greet and seat you. Their dishes are seasoned with spices that reflect Morocco‚Äôs history as a cultural crossroad. Choose from a variety of shared plates, entrees, and their famous tangines. It‚Äôs fragrant with earthy cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, and other spices which comes together in¬†a magical way. Eat healthy, eat happy with many of their dishes being vegan, halal and free of gluten, nuts, dairy and soy.

Orange Salad 12

Spicy Fava Bean Salad 12

Frenched Lamb Chops 40

Mussels in Lemon Broth with Peppers and Olives 34

Baklava 10
